name: 9.24 "Pitch It Again, Sam" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 9 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the breed of dog that Cliff found?
questions.explanation:
Dalmatian.

	Cliff named him Spotty. He was just a puppy.

questions.text: How much did Woody pay Cliff for Spotty?
questions.explanation:
$5.

	Cliff said at first that Woody couldn't have Spotty because he was a thoroughbred. When Woody offered to pay, Cliff quickly changed his mind.

Windmill.

	Rebecca asked what it was so the gang all started doing it. Woody asked Sam if he had a trademark. Sam replied, "Shut up and leave me alone."

Frasier.

	He said his mother never let him have pets as a child so he had a small fear of animals. Norm tried to get him over that, but Frasier offers to buy a beer for Norm if Spotty goes away.

questions.text: What team did Dutch Kincaid play for?
questions.explanation:
New York Yankees.

	They were having "Dutch Kincaid Day" at Yankee stadium. Dutch wanted Sam to pitch to him because every time Sam had pitched to him in the past, Dutch got a home run. Dutch Kincaid was played by Michael Fairman.

questions.text: Did Sam agree to pitch to Dutch?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Sam originally said he wouldn't. Then Kincaid insulted him again and Sam got fed up and agreed to pitch to him, planning to strike him out.

questions.text: Who did Sam say was missing when they were at Yankee Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Coach.

	Carla told Coach that Sam was there; she meant in spirit. Coach died several years ago.

questions.text: What did Kincaid's manager want Sam to do?
questions.explanation:
Take a dive.

	He told Sam to pitch the first two balls anyway he wanted but the third slowly over the plate so Dutch Kincaid could hit it. Sam said if Kincaid wanted a hit, he'd have to earn it.

questions.text: Who convinced Sam to let Kincaid hit a home run?
questions.explanation:
Billy Kincaid.

	Billy said he was Dutch's grandson. In reality he was the manager's kid and not related to Dutch at all.

questions.text: How many pitches did it take before Dutch hit a home run?
questions.explanation:
3.

	He threw two strikes at first. Carla yelled, "He can't hit what he can't see". Then Dutch hit a home run and Norm said, "Apparently he saw that one."
